result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt Martin Halvorson

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 8:30 AM Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson in court, in custody.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Kurt Martin Halvorson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson received information, waives reading. State recites agreement in 22CF129, 90 days jail with credit for 68 days, time served and pay mandatory court costs. In 22CT49 for Count 1, 20 days jail with credit for 20 days, concurrent to 22CF129, 16 month license revocation, 16 months IID, mandatory alcohol assessment and fine of $1,555 inclusive. Count 2 to be dismissed. 22CM92 to be dismissed. Defendant pleads guilty to sole count in 22CF129 and Count 1 in 22CT49. Attorney Anderson stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court orders in 22CF129, 90 days jail with credit for 68 days, time served and pay mandatory court costs. In 22CT49 for Count 1, 20 days jail with credit for 15 days, concurrent to 22CF129, 16 month license revocation, 16 months IID, mandatory alcohol assessment and fine of $1,555 inclusive. Count 2 dismissed. 22CM92 dismissed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Calling cases 22CF129 for Prelim and 22CM92 and 22CT49 for Status 
9:45 AM Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Kurt Martin Halvorson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Dfd appears in custody.
Exhibit 1 marked.
State calls witness- Officer Ronald Robinson. Sworn and Testifies.
March 21, 2022 conducted traffic stop in Superior on Hammond. ID'd with ID card and verbally. Officer ID's Dfd. No response from Atty Anderson. Record reflect ID of Dfd. 
Found Dfd had warrants and flag for fail to appear sex offender registry. Spoke with BCA and Duluth investigator. Tried to confirm address and he told me he lived at address on ID card. Investigator was pretty positive he was not living there. Saw vehicle outside 802 N 6th St Superior, WI that was registered to Dfd the first week of April. Vehicle was there 4 nights. Found out he had warrants and did surveillance at Superior address and arrested him when he came out. Dillon Janson told me Mr. Halvorson lived with him at 802 N 6th St for about 4 months.
Defense Atty cross examines witness. 
Monitored residence something like 4 nights and vehicle sat in driveway and never saw him moving it while I was there. Every time the house was monitored the car was in the driveway. 
Court asks questions of Officer. 
State has no other witnesses. 
Exhibit 1 offered - certified conviction from Blue Earth county - page 1 conviction and page 3 showing sex registry is required.
No response from Atty Anderson. 
Exhibit 1 received.
State requests bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. 
Set ARG on 22CF129 and status 22CM92 and 22CT49 on 6-17-22 at 8:30 AM
Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Calling Cases 22CF129 for preliminary hearing, 22CM92 and 22CT49 for STC

09:13AM Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson in court, in custody.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Kurt Martin Halvorson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Katie Garrett appearing via zoom, sworn and testifies
Employed for State of WI Dept of Corrections Sex Offender Registry

Attorney Anderson cross examines witness

State indicates to the Court that his next witness Officer Ronald Robinson is not available and request to continue hearing to next Wednesday.
Attorney Anderson has no objection
Court finds good cause; preliminary hearing to be continued due to witness unavailability.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Comply with all sex offender registries. Update address with the Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of release.

3:23 PM Calling Cases 22cf129, 22CM92, 22CT49
Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Attorney Michael Hoffman from public defender makes a special appearance.
.
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Requests PH. 
Court quashes warrants, questions non appearance.

State requests 22cm92-750cb, 22ct49 750cb no drugs, no drive, 22cf129 2000cb comply with registry
State recites lengthy criminal history, multiple failures to appear. unsure of ties to douglas county.

Court orders bail requested by the state. 2000cb in felony matter and 750cb in each of the misd cases.
cf file conditions comply with registry requirements
cm49-no drugs, no drive
on all cases must update address within 24 hours of release from custody.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
